intro: Thapsia nitida subsp. meridionalis, commonly known as the Southern Thapsia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial herb that typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant features a basal rosette of silver-gray, hairy leaves and produces tall, branching stems with small, yellow flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Apiaceae family.
